text: The Creuse () is a river in western France that flows through the Nouvelle- Aquitaine and Centre-Val de Loire regions. It rises in the Massif Central and flows into the Vienne river, as a right tributary. ==Geography== The Creuse river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of approximately . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Leugny, Vienne. From here, it generally flows to the northwest. Finally, the river flows into the Vienne river, on the right side, in the place known as Bec des Deux Eaux in the communes Port-de-Piles (Vienne), Ports and Nouâtre (Indre-et- Loire). The Creuse flows through 5 departments and 80 communes, in 2 regions; some of the communes are: * Centre-Val de Loire region ** Indre: Argenton-sur- Creuse, Le Blanc ** Indre-et-Loire: Yzeures-sur-Creuse, Descartes * Nouvelle- Aquitaine region ** Creuse (named after the river): Aubusson ** Vienne: La Roche-Posay ==Main tributaries == The main tributaries of the Creuse river are: Left tributaries: * Sédelle - 37.6 km * Gartempe - 204.6 Right tributaries: * Rozeille - 34.2 km * Petite Creuse - 95.1 km * Bouzanne - 84.2 km * Suin - 36.5 km ==Gallery== La Creuse à Yzeures.JPG|The Creuse in Yzeures sur Creuse Argenton-sur-Creuse (36) - Rivière.jpg|The Creuse in Argenton-sur- Creuse Saint-Gaultier la Creuse 01.JPG|The Creuse in Saint Gaultier ConfluentGartempe-Creuse.JPG|Confluence with the Gartempe river ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France ==References== ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Station L6020710 - La Creuse à Leugny Category:Rivers of Nouvelle- Aquitaine Category:Rivers of Centre-Val de Loire
